item.description:
You have to get your ticket directly from the French Cultural Center.  Posting here that you are going does not get you a ticket to the event.

==========================================================

 

The French Cultural Center's 36th Bastille Day Party returns to Marlborough Street for what promises to be the celebration of the summer! This year’s line-up, programmed by World Music/CRASHarts, Inc., features Yoro Ndiaye and his Afro-pop band, as well as Rupa and the April Fishes.


Want to help bring Boston's biggest celebration of francophone culture to life?

Volunteer for a few hours before, after, or during the event!

Volunteer duties include checking-in guests, bartending, helping restaurants set up their stands, and serving as an information resource for attendees, among other tasks.

Visit the following site to register to volunteer: https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/BastilleDay2011 .


More information about the French Cultural Center's 2011 Bastille Day Party :

Back Bay's beautiful Marlborough Street will be blocked off between Berkeley and Clarendon Streets to accommodate 2,000 revelers dancing in the street.

Delicious French food and drinks, including beer & wine will be available for sale.

The French Cultural Center Bastille Day will be a party in true French style with live music and dancing in celebration of freedom, community, cultural diversity, and friendship between nations.

Tickets:
$28 in advance
$35 day of event (subject to availability)  

Call 617.912.0400 to purchase your tickets.

Tickets printed from Meetup.com will not be accepted.

 

For more information, visit:

http://www.frenchculturalcenter.org/index.cfm/events/scheduled-events/bastille-day-2011/

group.name: The Boston Euro Social Meetup Group

item.name: Bastille Day Party at the French Cultural Center
